data.title: Summary of Antonio Canova
data.meta_description: arts lemuel - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. The document provides biographical information about Italian sculptor Antonio Canova (1757-1822), who was one of the leading figures of Neoclassical sculpture. It notes that he was born in Possagno, Italy and worked primarily in Rome, drawing inspiration from Classical antiquity. The document summarizes some of Canova's most famous works, including Daedalus and Icarus (1777-79), an early piece praised for its naturalism, and Theseus and the Minotaur (1781), commissioned by an important patron that established Canova's reputation. It also describes Psyche Revived by Cupid's Kiss (1787-93), a complex composition inspired by ancient
